title: Parmenides by Plato
description: Parmenides (ΠΑΡΜΕΝΙΔΗΣ) recounts a meeting between Socrates, Zeno and Parmenides. Topics discussed include universals, plurality and the One. Photograph: Cotton-Mill Worker, North Carolina by Lewis W. Hine. Translated by Benjamin Jowett. Audiobook read by Geoffrey Edwards.
content:encoded: Parmenides (ΠΑΡΜΕΝΙΔΗΣ) recounts a meeting between Socrates, Zeno and Parmenides. Topics discussed include universals, plurality and the One. Photograph: Cotton-Mill Worker, North Carolina by Lewis W. Hine. Translated by Benjamin Jowett. Audiobook read by Geoffrey Edwards.
itunes:subtitle: The philosophers Parmenides (ΠΑΡΜΕΝΙΔΗΣ) and Zeno of Elea (ΖΗΝΩΝ) discuss with a young Socrates questions such as whether only one thing exists or many and whether Beauty, Man and Hair have eternal Forms.
